answers.answer:
Yes, there are free language courses available for Ukrainian refugees in Romania, offering Romanian and English language courses for both children and adults.

To find detailed information, you can contact the International Organization for Migration (IOM) via their offices in Bucharest or email iombucarest@iom.int. You can also check the official Facebook pages or contact numbers provided for Centrul de Tineret FNT and JRS Romania, or visit JRS Romania's website at https://www.jrsromania.org. Additionally, TVR1 offers a Romanian video course on YouTube.
answers.bResponse:
Yes, there are free language courses available for Ukrainian refugees in Romania, offering Romanian and English language courses for both children and adults.

You can also check the official Facebook pages or contact numbers provided for Centrul de Tineret FNT and JRS Romania, or visit JRS Romania's website at https://www.jrsromania.org. Additionally, TVR1 offers a Romanian video course on YouTube. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/romanian-eng

answers.answer:
Ukrainian refugees in Romania are offered a variety of activities including language courses (Romanian and English), art therapy, music lessons, yoga, stretching, history classes, chess, drawing classes, educational and developmental activities, creative and sports activities, and psychological support, along with social and legal consultations.

To find more detailed information, you can visit the websites or Facebook pages of the organizations mentioned in the summary, such as IOM, Centrul de Tineret FNT, JRS Romania, and the Romanian-Finnish Highschool. Contact details like email addresses and phone numbers are also provided for specific programs and can be used to inquire further.

Children from Ukraine whose families are located in Bucharest or near the city and who have the status of temporary protection are eligible to enroll in programs at the Ukrainian Educational Center.

To find more detailed information, you can contact the Ukrainian Educational Center directly using the provided phone number (+40 726 646 733 - Olga Gireada) or look for their official website, if available, and navigate to sections like "Programs," "Eligibility," or "Enrollment."
